observations.content: Central hub for high-value, transferable programming patterns
Contains only proven solutions applicable across multiple projects
Focus: architectural decisions, performance patterns, reusable designs
NEVER edit shared-memory.json directly - ALWAYS use ukb command
ukb --interactive for insights, ukb --add-entity for patterns, ukb --add-relation for connections
ukb ensures proper formatting, validation, and MCP synchronization
Git-tracked JSON + MCP runtime + visualization sync
Cross-session persistence, agent-agnostic design, team collaboration
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/KnowledgePersistencePattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: Need to update knowledge base or capture insights
quick_reference.action: Use ukb command - never edit shared-memory.json directly
quick_reference.avoid: Direct JSON editing, manual file manipulation, bypassing ukb validation
quick_reference.check: git log --oneline -n 5 shared-memory.json (should show ukb commits only)

observations.content: Coding knowledge management system for development teams
Implements MCP persistence and cross-platform installation patterns
Automated capture and visualization of programming insights
Always implement network-aware detection with graceful fallbacks for enterprise environments
Network detection patterns, timeout-based operations, selective repository mirroring
Enterprise development tools, CI/CD systems, developer onboarding scripts
9/10 - Critical for enterprise software deployment
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/NetworkAwareInstallationPattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: Installation failing in corporate networks with proxies/SSH restrictions
quick_reference.action: Implement network detection with timeout-based fallbacks and graceful degradation
quick_reference.avoid: Hard-coded network assumptions, single-point-of-failure installs, no timeout handling
quick_reference.check: Test installation in corporate network environment with proxies enabled

observations.content: Implement mode-aware logging for different input/output contexts with MCP sync
Detect interactive vs piped mode, adjust logging accordingly, verify MCP memory sync
Interactive mode needs different logging approach than piped mode
Any AI-assisted development system with MCP integration
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/MCPMemoryLoggingIntegrationPattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: AI system with MCP integration failing in interactive vs piped mode
quick_reference.action: Implement mode-aware logging with MCP memory sync verification
quick_reference.avoid: Single-mode logging assumptions, missing sync verification, interactive mode hangs
quick_reference.check: Test both interactive and piped modes, verify MCP memory persistence

observations.content: Integrate knowledge management directly into IDE to eliminate context switching
VSCode extension with GitHub Copilot chat participant @km, HTTP API client, WebSocket for real-time updates
Seamless knowledge capture with <500ms response time and real-time notifications
Any IDE-based developer tool integration requiring chat interfaces
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/VSCodeExtensionBridgePattern.md

quick_reference.trigger: Context switching between IDE and knowledge management tools disrupts development flow
quick_reference.action: Implement native IDE integration through GitHub Copilot chat participant with HTTP API client
quick_reference.avoid: External tool switching, manual knowledge capture outside IDE, context disruption
quick_reference.check: Seamless knowledge capture with <500ms response time and real-time notifications

observations.content: 1. Use claude-mcp 2. Query existing patterns 3. Start vkb visualization 4. Follow logging/state rules
NEVER console.log, NEVER edit shared-memory.json, NEVER useState for complex state, ALWAYS use ukb
Session start → Pattern queries → Development → Knowledge capture → Git sharing
ukb (auto/interactive/agent), vkb (start/stop/status), MCP memory sync
Redux for React complex state, Logger for all output, ukb for knowledge management
Details: http://localhost:8080/knowledge-management/insights/CodingWorkflow.md

quick_reference.trigger: Starting any coding session or implementing new features
quick_reference.action: Follow startup checklist: check patterns, verify compliance, capture insights
quick_reference.avoid: console.log, direct JSON editing, skipping pattern queries, useState for complex state

entities.name: UkbCli
observations: UKB script had grown too large and complex (3000+ lines), making it difficult to maintain and extend. The monolithic bash script mixed concerns and lacked a stable API for cross-platform knowledge management.

Complete refactoring from bash script to Node.js CLI tool with modular architecture, stable API, and comprehensive documentation. Created ukb-cli package with separated concerns, proper error handling, and enhanced functionality.
Node.js provides better cross-platform compatibility, superior JSON handling, npm ecosystem access, and cleaner architecture. Modular design enables easier testing, maintenance, and feature addition.

Refactoring large bash scripts requires careful planning to preserve functionality while improving architecture. Node.js CLI tools offer superior maintainability and cross-platform support compared to complex bash scripts.
Cross-platform knowledge management systems, CLI tool refactoring, bash-to-node migration, modular system architecture

entities.name: VkbCli
observations: VKB visualization system grew complex with server management, data processing, and web interface coordination challenges. Monolithic bash script lacked proper error handling and cross-platform reliability.

Complete refactoring from bash script to Node.js CLI tool with VKBServer class API, Commander.js interface, and modular data processing. Created vkb-server package with separated concerns and cross-platform compatibility.
Node.js provides superior process management, HTTP server control, and JSON handling. Modular architecture enables programmatic server control and easier maintenance.
Server management systems benefit from structured APIs over bash process control. Node.js CLI tools provide better error handling and status reporting for long-running services.
Knowledge visualization servers, web service management, CLI-to-service bridges, development server orchestration
